result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc K Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment or counseling deemed necessary by agent.  Complete AODA and follow through treatment should focus on using drugs.  

DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE/schooling/combination of the two.
Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances and alcohol.

Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling deemed necessary by agent. 

Complete AODA with follow through. 

DNA sample if not already on file.

Court costs as previously assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marc K Thomas

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:43pm
INCLUDES 15CF659, 17CF856, 17CF1098, 17CF1410
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Travis Slattery.
Date and time set for SAR in 15CF659 & plea in 17CF856, 17CF1098, 17CF1410

** PLEA in 17CF856, 17CF1098, 17CF1410 **
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
17CF1098:
Ct. 1 Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)- conspiracy to commit- repeater- second and subsequent offense >> D&RI
17CF1410:
Ct. 1 Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)- repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Battery- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA:
17CF856:
Ct. 1 Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)- repeater- second and subsequent offense >> NO CONTEST
17CF1410:
Ct. 2 Retail Theft- Intentionally take (<=$500)- repeater >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 4 Disorderly Conduct- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 17CF856 Ct. 1- 6 years WSPS- 2 years IC, 4 years ES. 17CF1410 Ct. 2 & Ct. 4- 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. Deft would be eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration. All sentences to run concurrent each other and concurrent to SAR in 15CF659. 165 days of jail credit granted. CONDITIONS of ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances and alcohol. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide DNA sample if not already on file. 

** SAR in 15CF659 **
 Parties state recommendation for sentencing.
COURT makes findings.
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 Possession of Cocaine (2nd+): 3 and half years WSPS- 1 and half years IC, 2 years ES. Sentence to run concurrent to 17CF856 Ct. 1 & 17CF1410 Ct. 2 & Ct. 4.  Deft would be eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration. 165 days of jail credit granted. CONDITIONS of ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances and alcohol. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide DNA sample if not already on file. 
Adj: 4:01pm
Review hearing on March 16, 2018 at 08:45 am.

tracking with BR 4 open file

RH 3/16/18 @ 8:45am
Review hearing on March 1, 2018 at 09:30 am.

held early

PD has not appointed on SAR or open files yet

CC 1/29/18 @ 1pm
Calendar call on January 22, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
